body.header: Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Click FOUR letters A-G.

section.p:
Questions 9-12
Which FOUR pieces of advice about writing a CV does the speaker give?

p.g: A. You should find out about the company you are applying to.
B. You should make your CV stand out from other applicants' CVs.
C. You should be careful not to make any mistakes.
D. You should use white paper for your CV.
E. You should be truthful on your CV.
F. You should limit the length of your CV.
G. You should keep a copy of your CV for yourself.

section.p: A. Mary does not mention this at all.
B. Mary says your CV should be unique and 'attract an employer's attention'. In other words 'stand out'.
C. Mary says that accuracy is important and that you shouldn't make any spelling, grammar, punctuation or spacing errors. The word 'errors' has the same meaning as 'mistakes'.
D. Mary does not mention the paper you should use.
E. Mary says that honesty is important and that you should never include false information on your CV. 'Honesty' means the same as 'truthfulness'.
F. Mary says that conciseness is important too. She says that your CV should never go beyond two sides of A4 paper. In other words, limit the length.
